page.title: 09NATURE TRAIL: KILDWICK INGS
page.content: We went to the river bank and we climbed over the stile. Then we went over a gate and to the stream running under the bridge. We jumped over it. We walked round to the other bit of the bridge and jumped back over the water. We carried on walking and came to an island. Mr. Ackroyd said we could paddle. We went into a field where there were some tree stumps. In the next field there were some bulls. Mr. Ackroyd said "Keep to the levee." He told us that a levee is a bank made to stop flooding. In the next field we saw sycamore and ash trees. We then saw a hole in the bank where we thought a rabbit lived. On the way back we picked some flowers to press.
